required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Use of Activated Recombinant Human Factor VII to Reduce Bleeding Caused by Warfarin Treatment
clinical_study.official_title: Use of Recombinant FVIIa to Mitigate Warfarin Anticoagulation Therapy-Mediated Bleeding in a Single Centre, Randomized, Placebo-controlled, Double-blind Clinical Trial

brief_summary.textblock: This trial is conducted in the United States of America (USA). The aim of this trial is to evaluate the efficacy of activated recombinant human factor VII to mitigate experimentally-induced bleeding in healthy volunteers treated with warfarin to reach a targeted INR (International Normalization Ratio).

primary_outcome.measure: Bleeding duration measured in minutes after biopsies in trial part A
primary_outcome.time_frame: From onset of bleeding till the end of the bleeding

primary_outcome.measure: Bleeding duration measured in minutes after biopsy B1 in trial part B
primary_outcome.time_frame: From onset of bleeding till the end of the bleeding

secondary_outcome.measure: Blood volume reported in millilitres after biopsies in trial part A
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From onset of bleeding till the end of the bleeding

secondary_outcome.measure: Blood volume reported in millilitres after biopsy B1 in trial part B
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From onset of bleeding till the end of the bleeding

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in coagulation-related parameters after biopsy B1
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From baseline to 3 hours after B1

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in coagulation-related parameters after biopsy B2
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From baseline to 3 hours after B2

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in coagulation-related parameters after biopsy B3
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From baseline to 3 hours after B3

secondary_outcome.measure: Clot dynamics: R in minutes (trial part B)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Time to onset of clot formation

secondary_outcome.measure: Clot dynamics: K in minutes (trial part B)

intervention.description: After a baseline punch biopsy (B0), warfarin is administered over a period of approximately 7-14 days. Dose is adjusted individually to achieve INR target. Once a stable INR is achieved, a second biopsy (B1) will be performed

If the subject is eligible to continue in trial part B, trial drug will be administered i.v. as a slow bolus injection over 2 to 5 minutes in five different doses followed by two biopsies (B2) and (B3) 15 minutes and 5 hours and 15 minutes, respectively, after trial drug administration

If the subject is eligible to continue in trial part B, trial drug will be administered i.v. as a slow bolus injection over 2 to 5 minutes in five different doses followed by two biopsies (B2) and (B3) 15 minutes and 5 hours and 15 minutes, respectively, after trial drug administration

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- INR below or equal to 1.2
Exclusion Criteria:
- The receipt of any investigational drug within 1 month prior to this trial
- Use of anticoagulation therapy-defined as vitamin K antagonists, platelet antagonists, heparin (or low molecular weight heparin), aspirin or NSAIDs (Non-Steroidal Anti-Inflammatory Drug) within 14 days prior to trial
- African-American race
- Weight above 160 kg
- Supplemental Vitamin K use
